noun.description: (in fantasy literature and games) a member of an imaginary race of humanlike creatures, characterized as ugly, warlike, and malevolent.

origin: Late 16th century (denoting an ogre): perhaps from Latin orcus hell or Italian orco demon, monster, influenced by obsolete orc ferocious sea creature and by Old English orcneas monsters. The current sense is due to the use of the word in Tolkien's fantasy adventures.
